sections.text: DefinitionsSection 37-173-3 - Mississippi Dyslexia Therapy Scholarship for Students with Dyslexia Program establishedSection 37-173-5 - Option to remove child from traditional school and enroll in public or nonpublic school that meets standards for unique learning needs of students with dyslexia; scholarship eligibility requirementsSection 37-173-7 - Student eligibility for scholarship; duration of scholarshipSection 37-173-9 - Public school option; nonpublic school optionSection 37-173-11 - Parental obligations if applying for Mississippi Dyslexia Therapy ScholarshipSection 37-173-13 - Maximum scholarship; report by nonpublic schools; disbursement of payments to nonpublic schoolsSection 37-173-15 - Screening of all compulsory-school-age children enrolled in public school for dyslexia; subsequent dyslexia evaluationsSection 37-173-16 - Determination of eligibility of students diagnosed with dyslexia for Individualized Education Program or 504 Plan; required in-service training in dyslexia and related disorder awareness education for licensed educators and paraprofessionalsSection 37-173-17 - Eligibility requirements for nonpublic schools to participate in scholarship programSection 37-173-19 - Publication of information regarding Mississippi Dyslexia Therapy Scholarship; annual reportsSection 37-173-21 - Administrative and instructional personnel qualificationsSection 37-173-22 - Dyslexia therapist license issued through reciprocitySection 37-173-23 - Criminal background checks and fingerprinting of school personnelSection 37-173-25 - Payment of federal and state aid program monies to participating schools; audit and budget submission requirementsSection 37-173-27 - Liability for award or use of Mississippi Dyslexia Therapy ScholarshipSection 37-173-29 - No expansion of regulatory authority of state over nonpublic schools beyond what is necessary to enforce this chapterSection 37-173-31 - [Repealed]
